paragraph.heading:
Habenaria reniformis (D.Don) Hook.
f.,
Fl. Brit. India
6: 152, 1890

subSubSection.paragraph:
Basionym:
Listera reniformis D.Don, Prodr. Fl.
Nepal
.: 28, 1825.

Homotypic synonym:
Neottia reniformis (D.Don) Spreng., Syst. Veg.
3: 707, 1826.

Specimens examined:—
CHIN . Mindat District :
1200 m
,
2 Sep 2011
, Funakoshi et al. 085039 ( MBK )
.
MANDALAY . Myingyan District :
26 Oct 2009
, Saw Lwin et al. MPO 020 ( SING )
.
Distribution:— India , the Himalayas, Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina, southern China and western Indonesia ( Sumatra ).

Habenaria rodgeri
W.W.Sm. & Banerji, Rec. Bot. Surv.
India
6: 34, 1914. Type :— MYANMAR . Mandalay Region : Pyinoolwin District ,
305 m
,
Sep 1910
, Rodger 201 ( holotype : CAL; isotype: K)

Habenaria rhodocheila
auctt. plur. non Hance

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Habenaria erichmichelii
auct. non Christenson:
Tanaka et al. (2011: 164)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens examined:—
CHIN . Falam District :
1830 m
, 1923,
Daun 98
( K )
;
Mindat District :
1370 m
,
15 Sep 1956
,
Maung Gale-2 5785 p.p.
( RAF )
;
same loc.,
900 m
,
21 Sep 1956
,
Kingdon-Ward 22700
( BM )
.
MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District : type ; same loc.,
1065 m
,
Samuel 13582
( K )
;
Myingyan District :
15 Sep 2002
,
Khin Myo Htwe 024088 A
( MBK , TI )
;
same loc.,
Saw Lwin s.n.
( SING , SING [s])
.
Distribution:— Endemic.

Notes:— The species has been considered conspecific with the widespread
H. rhodocheila Hance
but differs strikingly in its foliage (broadly ovate-lanceolate and green basal leaves with whitish mottling). Vegetatively, the plants resemble
H. carnea Weathers
from Peninsular Thailand and Malaysia , which has a different floral structure. Daun 98 was in fact originally identified as ‘a form of
H. carnea
’. We have provisionally recognised
H. rodgeri
as a distinct species but suggest that a study of the entire
H. rhodocheila
group needs to be undertaken in order to clarify its taxonomy.

Habenaria rostrata Wall. ex Lindl.
,
Gen . Sp. Orchid. Pl.
: 325, 1835. Type:— MYANMAR . Bago Region : Pyay District , 1826, Wallich, Numer. List: no. 7051A ( holotype : K-LINDL; isotype: GH)

Homotypic synonym:
Habenaria acuifera Wall. ex Lindl. var. rostrata (Wall. ex Lindl.) Finet, Rev.
Gén . Bot.
13: 526, 1901.

Specimens examined:—
SHAN . Loilen District :
1370 m
,
27 Jul 1911
, Robertson 383 ( K )
.
BAGO . Pyay District : type . WITHOUT LOCALITY. Parish 228 (not located), fide Parish (1883: 201) . Reported from
Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 81)
, but we have not seen material from this area.
Distribution:— Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Habenaria shweliensis
W.W.Sm. & Banerji, Rec. Bot. Surv.
India
6: 33, 1914. Type :— MYANMAR . Shan State : Kyaukme District ,
Sep 1910
,
Rodger 387
( holotype : CAL; isotype: K)

Specimens examined:—
MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District :
Jul 1912
,
Lace s.n.
( E ), ident. uncertain; Myingyan District :
12 Aug 2011
, Kim s.n. , photo
.
SHAN . Kyaukme District : type ; Taunggyi District :
18 Aug 2018
,
Kim s.n.
, photo, ident. uncertain; same loc.,
25 Jul 2019
, 1215–
1380 m
,
Hervouet s.n.
, photo; Loilen District :
1370 m
,
25 Jul 1911
, Robertson 381 ( K )
.
Distribution:— Endemic.

Note:—
Habenaria crassilabia Kraenzl.
from China , Korea and Japan has been treated as a synonym of this species, but recently Yukawa & Yagi (2011) have recognized the former as a good species. Thus
H. shweliensis
is endemic to Myanmar .

Habenaria spatulifolia C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f., Trans. Linn. Soc. London 30: 140, 1874. Type :— MYANMAR . Tenasserim :? Kayin State :?Hpa-An District ,
Parish 217
( holotype : K)

Specimen examined:— ?
KAYIN .?Hpa-An District : type . Also reported from
Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 81)
, but we have not seen material from this area.
Distribution:— Endemic.
